title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to lay off 20% of its workforce as part of a strategy to merge operations with Viator.
The company aims to become experience-led and AI-enabled, integrating platforms with ChatGPT within weeks.
Tripadvisor's restructuring includes an $85 million cost-savings program impacting 600 global employees.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An abandoned tent in New Hampshire's White Mountains was reported to Fish and Game on October 26.
The tent, found near Mt. Madison, contained wet gear and food but no signs of its owner.
Social media posts about the tent have generated attention, but the owner remains unidentified.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader, passed away on November 1, 2025, due to ovarian cancer.
She founded CharityTeams in 2008, raising $42 million for nonprofits through athletic events like the Boston Marathon.
A Celebration of Life will be held on November 8 in Norwood, with donations suggested to her supported charities.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket launches 'More For Your Dollar' lager in collaboration with Zero Gravity Beer, a Vermont craft brewery.
The 12-pack of Market Basket beer is priced at $12.99, available in selected Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire locations.
The release follows the recent exit of CEO Arthur T. Demoulas amid corporate transitions and customer excitement.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts public defenders' work stoppage began in May, targeting a pay increase from the Legislature for court-appointed attorneys.
State lawmakers approved a 30% pay raise for bar advocates, yet over 900 defendants remain unrepresented in court.
The Supreme Judicial Court is considering the power to intervene in pay disputes, with arguments focused on separation of powers.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston for a private dinner and book signing.
She was in Boston to speak at Harvard Business School about her debut novel, "Gone Before Goodbye," co-authored with Harlan Coben.
Witherspoon discussed her Reese’s Book Club, highlighting its focus on women-centered books by female authors.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey's aide, LaMar Cook, arrested for cocaine trafficking, prompting GOP criticism of her vetting process.
Republican lawmakers demand Healey disclose details of Cook's 2023 hiring, questioning her administration's background check efficacy.
GOP gubernatorial candidates call for independent investigation into Healey's hiring practices following Cook's cocaine charges.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, died in a crash on Route 140 in New Bedford.
Massachusetts State Police found a 2019 Honda Civic severely damaged with two ejected occupants at 2 a.m. Saturday.
An 18-year-old driver from Dartmouth was injured, while a GoFundMe for Siqueira's funeral exceeded $26,000 in donations.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are seeking public assistance to identify a suspect involved in a series of commercial burglaries since August 21.
The suspect reportedly used a pry tool to enter downtown businesses, stealing credit cards, cash, and electronics.
Similar incidents have been reported by police at Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University. Contact Boston police at 617-343-4571 with information.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tennessee Titans reportedly avoided trading with the New England Patriots over past issues with coach Mike Vrabel.
Owner Amy Adams Strunk still holds ill will over Vrabel's departure after his 2023 firing from the Titans.
The Patriots were interested in deals during the NFL trade deadline but didn't make any significant moves.
